title: Steelers' Metcalf shoves fan during game in Detroit
content: Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf was involved in an altercation with a fan at Ford Field during the second quarter of Sunday's 29-24 win over the Detroit Lions.

title: Back injury forces Ravens' Jackson from SNF loss
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson left Sunday night's game against the Patriots late in the first half because of a back injury. He was replaced by Tyler Huntley.

title: Lions own loss after late OPI calls: 'It's on us'
content: The Detroit Lions owned their big loss after late offensive pass interference calls, with coach Dan Campbell saying, "It's on us."

content: The Red Sox have acquired first baseman Willson Contreras from the Cardinals in exchange for right-hander Hunter Dobbins and additional pitching, sources told ESPN.

content: After a narrative-changing victory over the top-seeded Broncos in Denver, the Jaguars say they don't want anyone jumping on the bandwagon now.

title: Sources: Chiefs fear Minshew suffered ACL tear
content: One week after losing starter Patrick Mahomes to an ACL tear, Chiefs quarterback Gardner Minshew is feared to also have suffered a torn ACL, sources told ESPN.

title: Jones: Cowboys 'underachieved' in 2025 season
content: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones expressed his disappointment Sunday with how the season has gone for his team.

title: Crosby leaps Lemieux as Pens' all-time top scorer
content: Sidney Crosby broke Mario Lemieux's franchise scoring record with a goal and an assist in the first period of the Pittsburgh Penguins' 4-3 win over the Montreal Canadiens on Sunday, giving him 645 goals and 1,079 assists for 1,724 points in 1,387 games.

content: The big cat was surrounded by elephants several times from morning to afternoon, before being tranquillised and brought to Sukatra airstrip

content: 300 MSMEs will be identified and supported to develop import-substitution products across the six sectors

content: The absence of the university‚Äôs option is causing career-related problems for the students, the Sangh said

title: Ensuring selection process is transparent and merit-based top priority , says new UPESSC chairman Prashant Kumar
content: Technology-based processes will be strengthened by the commission to carry out recruitment in a timely manner

title: The Jats draw up new power plans
content: Members of the community, who held significant power in north Indian politics for decades, have lost their grip on it over the past few years due to various social, political, and economic factors. Now, they are seeking new alliances among other agrarian communities to revive their influence, evident from recent conferences and¬†panchayats, finds¬†Ashok Kumar

title: A model tribal school in Maharashtra battles water scarcity to fight migration
content: The Hiwali school has been seeking solar power and a KT dam or Kolhapur-Type Weir, a low-cost, gravity-based riverbed structure that acts as a small dam or barrage to store post-monsoon river flow for water supply

title: SIR in T.N. leads to deletion of 2.6 lakh more women than men from electoral rolls
content: Data points to marriage-related migration being the cause behind higher deletions of women‚Äôs names from electoral rolls

title: A gripping account from prison and a powerful argument for reforms
content: The book Oru Thooku Kaithiyin Vaakumoolam, authored by Selvam, who was once condemned to death for a murder, goes far beyond his personal story and his 31 years in prison. It provides a detailed account of the turf wars that engulfed Kanniyakumari district in the late 1980s

title: President grants assent to SHANTI Bill that opens up nuclear sector for private participation
content: The law enables private companies and joint ventures to build, own, operate and decommission nuclear power plants under a license from the government

title: Watch: Centre rejects mining claims, says Aravalli hills remain protected
content: The Centre has rejected reports that the definition of the Aravalli hills was changed to permit large-scale mining, citing a Supreme Court-ordered freeze on new leases. The clarification follows controversy over the ‚Äú100-metre‚Äù criterion used to define hills across states.

title: Suspended Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir announces plans to float new political party
content: The announcement of the construction of Babri Masjid at Beldanga that has drawn large crowds to the venue; Every day, hundreds of people bring bricks to the venue and offer donations for the construction of the mosque

title: Bengal police warn against drawing a parallel between Bangladesh murder and Murshidabad lynching
content: The police warn of action against those attempting to communalise criminal incidents. Several BJP leaders had made references to the lynching of a father-son duo in Murshidabad in April 2025, against the backdrop of the recent murder of Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh.

title: Newly elected local body members in Ernakulam take oath amid cheers
content: A total of 2,220 representatives, elected to 111 local bodies in the district, took oath at different venues. As many as 1,467 members in 82 grama panchayats, 202 in 14 block panchayats, and 447 members in 13 municipalities also took oath at the respective centres

title: Uproar over attack on meat shop owner in U.P.‚Äôs Aligarh
content: Opposition alleges attempt to create fear, says fringe Hindutva elements vitiating communal harmony of society

title: Gandhi lives in the people‚Äôs hearts: Congress leader Karra
content: J&K Congress president and legislator Tariq Hamid Karra raised anti-government and pro-Gandhi slogans along with his supporters

title: Maharashtra local body poll results: PM Modi thanks people of for supporting BJP-led Mahayuti
content: The State Election Commission has not yet declared the results of all 286 municipal councils and nagar panchayats, which went to polls in two phases on December 2 and 20

title: Pune Local Polls Victory Celebrations Turn Tragic, Councilor Among 16 Injured In Fire
content: The incident took place during a victory procession of newly elected councillors and party workers in Pune.

title: Bangladesh's "Scale Back" Threat As India Rejects Delhi Protest "Propaganda"
content: India has rejected what it called "misleading propaganda" in sections of the Bangladeshi media over a protest held in front of the Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi against the killing of a Hindu man.

title: Science Meets Faith: ISRO Team Seeks Blessings At Tirupati Temple Ahead Of Satellite Launch
content: Ahead of a crucial upcoming mission, the launch team of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) visited the Tirumala Tirupati temple in Andhra Pradesh to seek blessings from Lord Venkateswara.

title: H-1B Visa Holders Who Returned To Renew Work Permits Stranded In India
content: The US State Department, in an email, reportedly informed the Indian workers that their interviews were delayed due to the new social media vetting policy.

title: South Korea Parliament Passes Bill To Launch Probe Into 2024 Jeju Air Crash
content: South Korea's parliament passed a bill on Monday to launch an independent probe into the Jeju Air plane crash in December 2024 that killed 179 people in the deadliest air disaster on the country's soil.

title: "Violence Has Become Norm": Sheikh Hasina Blasts Yunus As Dhaka Simmers
content: Violence has become the norm in Bangladesh, and the interim government headed by Muhammad Yunus is either in denial or powerless to stop it, the country's ousted Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, has said

title: Delhi Struggles With Very Poor Air Quality, Dense Smog Reduces Visibility
content: The national capital continued to reel under heavy smog on Monday morning, with air quality levels remaining in the "very poor" category and several areas slipping into "severe" pollution levels.

title: 16 Dead, 18 Injured As Passenger Bus Loses Control, Crashes In Indonesia
content: The bus carrying 34 people lost control on a toll road and struck a concrete barrier before rolling onto its side, said Budiono, a search and rescue agency chief who goes by single name like many Indonesians.

title: "Very Memorable Occasion": 1st Foodgrain Freight Train Reaches J&K's Anantnag
content: The first-ever foodgrain freight train of the Food Corporation of India (FCI) reached the Anantnag Goods Terminal here in Kashmir on Sunday, formally integrating the region with the national freight rail network

title: KCR Signals Return To Active Politics, Launches "Direct War" Against Congress
content: Breaking a nearly two-year hiatus from active street politics, Bharat Rashtra Samithi chief and former Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao has officially declared a "direct war" against the ruling Congress government.

title: "We Felt It": Asim Munir Says Pakistan Received "Divine Help" During Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's Defence Chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir, has claimed that Islamabad received 'divine help' during the country's military confrontation with India in May after India struck terror targets under Operation Sindoor.

title: Starbucks Names Indian-Origin Amazon Veteran Anand Varadarajan As Top Tech Officer
content: Starbucks has appointed Indian-origin technology executive Anand Varadarajan as its new executive vice president and chief technology officer (CTO), tapping a nearly two-decade Amazon veteran to lead its global technology operations.

title: "Russia Lacks Capability To Occupy Ukraine, Let Alone Invade Europe": Tulsi Gabbard
content: Russia "does not have the capability to conquer and occupy Ukraine," let alone invade Europe, US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard has said, accusing "deep state warmongers" and sections of the Western media

title: US Restores Trump's Pic In Epstein Files Amid Backlash. It Has A Melania Link
content: The US Department of Justice (DoJ) has restored a photograph from the recent batch of Jeffrey Epstein files that featured images of American President Donald Trump after backlash over its removal.

title: AI Resurrections Of Queen Elizabeth, Michael Jackson Amuse, Rankle Internet
content: In a parallel reality, Queen Elizabeth II gushes over cheese puffs, a gun-toting Saddam Hussein struts into a wrestling ring, and Pope John Paul II attempts skateboarding.

title: Japan To Restart World's Biggest Nuclear Plant, 15 Years After Fukushima
content: Kashiwazaki-Kariwa, located about 220 km northwest of Tokyo, was among 54 reactors shut after a massive earthquake and tsunami crippled the Fukushima Daiichi plant in the worst nuclear disaster since Chernobyl.

title: President Droupadi Murmu Grants Assent To Shanti Bill, Private Firms To Enter Nuclear Sector
content: President Droupadi Murmu has granted assent to the Sustainable Harnessing and Advancement of Nuclear Energy for Transforming India (SHANTI) Bill, passed by Parliament during the Winter Session.

title: Donald Trump Is Leaning On Son-In-law Jared Kushner For Difficult Diplomacy
content: Now, nearly a year into Trump 2.0, Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner has been drawn back into the foreign policy fold and is taking a greater role in delicate peace negotiations.

title: BJP Emerges As Largest Party In Maharashtra Local Polls, Alliance Wins Big
content: The Mahayuti alliance of the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP has swept the elections to 288 municipal councils and nagar panchayats by winning 207 posts of presidents of local bodies Sunday.

title: Trump Administration Recalls Biden-Era Ambassadors From 29 Countries
content: The Trump administration is recalling nearly 30 career diplomats from ambassadorial and other senior embassy posts as it moves to reshape the US diplomatic posture abroad with personnel deemed fully supportive of Trump's "America First" priorities.

title: TCS to commence operations in Visakhapatnam in January 2026
content: IT major to launch Delivery Centre from rented facility at Rushikonda with 2,000 employees and ‚Çπ80 crore initial investment

content: Several speakers highlighted the reservation policy that¬†puts open merit students at a disadvantage with only 30% quota

content: BJP leader says the DMK is underestimating the political and administrative capabilities of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and slams ‚ÄòTASMAC Minister‚Äô

content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh alleged that the nuclear energy legislation was pushed through Parliament to favour U.S. interests and Adani Group‚Äôs entry into the sector

title: BJP dominates panchayat polls in Arunachal, wins bulk of ZPM, GPM seats
content: The Peoples' Party of Arunachal (PPA) emerged as the second-largest force with 28 seats, while the Congress secured seven seats in the zila parishad constituencies

title: Coal block allocation case petitioner lawyer M.L. Sharma passes away
content: He filed multiple public interest litigations, notably on the abrogation of Article 370, the Pegasus spyware controversy, and the Rafale case

title: Chalachitra Academy‚Äôs stand on denial of censor exemption to films at IFFK slammed
content: Resul Pookutty, the Oscar-winning artistic director of the festival made a shocking statement by resorting to the usual ‚Äúanti-national‚Äù rhetoric that the BJP is famous for, says statement

content: Candidates selected from 54,000 registrants across 48 skill trades; winners to compete at regional level in February 2026, leading to WorldSkills Shanghai

title: Walayar mob lynching: K.C. Venugopal calls State government‚Äôs apathy shocking
content: AICC general secretary demands compensation for victim‚Äôs family, strict action against those responsible

title: Political conspiracy behind construction of Babri Masjid will broaden rift, says RSS chief
content: The remark by the RSS chief comes in the wake of a call given by suspended Trinamool Congress MP Humayun Kabir to construct ‚ÄòBabri Masjid‚Äô at Beldanga in Murshidabad district.

title: Vikasit Chhattisgarh within reach as anti-Naxal operations gain ground: Chief Minister
content: Vishnu Deo Sai says ending Left Wing Extremism will unlock the State‚Äôs mineral and forest wealth and accelerate development through improved inter-State connectivity

title: Congress slams government for ‚Äòdismantling‚Äô MGNREGA after passage of VB-G Ram G Bill
content: Party leader K.C. Venugopal says the Modi government had effectively dismantled the MGNREGA by converting it from a right to a favour

title: Stand-off at Thrissur MCH as Walayar lynching victim‚Äôs family refuses to receive body
content: Family of migrant worker Ram Narayan demands ‚Çπ25 lakh compensation, mob-lynching charges, and state support to transport body home

title: Odisha Governor lays stress on cultural integration at ABVP State convention
content: Haribabu  urges the youth wing to launch a tirade against rampant drug menace in the country and create awareness among fellow students on the impact of substance abuse

title: Snowfall ends long dry spell, heralds the revival of festive year-end tourism in Kashmir Valley
content: Tourists were mesmerised by a thick, white blanket of snow, setting the stage for Christmas and New Year celebrations, and winter sports in the Valley

title: TTD donates breath analysers to Tirupati police
content: They help in preventing road accidents and ensuring adherence to traffic rules, says Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal after handing over the gadgets to Superintendent of Police Subbarayudu

title: Local body polls 2025: members take oath in local bodies across Kerala, spotlight on Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: In the 2025 local body elections, the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation had witnessed a seismic shift with the LDF losing its grip on the 101-ward civic body after more than four decades.

title: Justice delayed: consumers caught in a web of systemic inconsistencies
content: Long travel, repeated adjournments and mounting backlogs are turning consumer courts into a test of endurance for litigants.

title: Post deadline extension, Waqf Board deals with  new challenges
content: Focus will be on registering the 3,000 institutions enumerated under kitabul waqf, and 13,000 registered under second waqf survey

title: Post-SIR, size of electorate in Chennai and nearby districts remains larger than votes polled in 2021 and 2026 polls
content: Only in four constituencies ‚Äî Villivakkam, R.K. Nagar, Perambur, and Anna Nagar ‚Äî did the number of votes polled in 2021 exceed the revised strength of the electorate

title: SIT seeks VSSC expertise to quantify original gold content in Sabarimala temple‚Äôs gilded panels
content: VSSC‚Äôs metallurgical analysis report may provide SIT with a scientific baseline for comparing metallurgical nature of the original gilded panels with those returned to the temple after restoration by prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti in 2019

title: Thrissur Corporation councillors, district panchayat members take oath
content: All 56 councillors sworn in as first council meeting held; oath ceremony of district panchayat members  held at  District Planning Bhavan

title: Delhi airport assault: Pilot alleges casteist abuse; claims passenger threatened family
content: Air India Express Captain Virender Sejwal has accused passenger Ankit Dewan of making casteist remarks and issuing threats to his family. The captain's lawyer stated Dewan initiated the confrontation, leading to a physical altercation where Sejwal was also injured. Both parties reportedly signed a voluntary statement not to pursue legal action.

title: T20 WC: Hardik Pandya hits top gear - Explosive return vs SA shows why he remains India's MVP
content: Hardik Pandya's stellar comeback from injury in the T20I series against South Africa has cemented his status as India's T20 MVP. His explosive batting and crucial wickets, including a 16-ball fifty, were instrumental in India's 3-1 series win. South Africa's coach lauded Pandya's impact, highlighting his vital role in the series.

title: J&K: 6-yr old boy finds 'toy' in garbage, turns out to be 'Chinese-made weapon-mountable telescope'
content: Police in Jammu and Kashmir recovered a Chinese-made weapon-mountable telescope from a six-year-old boy in Sidhra, who reportedly found it in a garbage dump. A separate search operation was launched in Udhampur after terrorists allegedly stole food from a house before fleeing into a forest, days after a deadly encounter.

title: SoftBank races for $22.5bn OpenAI deal: Masayoshi Son goes ‚Äòall-in‚Äô; IPO plans in play
content: SoftBank is reportedly nearing a $22.5 billion funding commitment to OpenAI, employing aggressive tactics like selling major stakes in Nvidia and T-Mobile. CEO Masayoshi Son's "all-in" move aims to dominate AI, with plans including a joint venture for US AI infrastructure and a potential PayPay IPO.

title: GRAP Stage-IV in Gurugram explained: Timings changed, WFH pushed for offices
content: The Deputy Commissioner Gurugram has implemented revised office timings and a work from home advisory in response to deteriorating air quality. The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has invoked Stage-IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR. State Government offices will operate from 09:30 AM to 05:30 PM, municipal offices from 08:30 AM to 04:30 PM, and private offices are advised to allow 50% staff to work remotely until further notice, as posted on X.

title: 'No energy left': Rohit Sharma makes candid revelations; opens up about 2023 World Cup final
content: Former India captain Rohit Sharma revealed he considered quitting cricket after the 2023 ODI World Cup final loss to Australia. The emotional toll of the defeat, after investing heavily since becoming captain, left him feeling drained. It took months of recovery and self-reflection to regain his passion for the sport.

title: 'Is this your father‚Äôs car?': Rapido driver assaults woman, hurls abuses in Gurgaon
content: A Rapido cab driver was arrested within hours for allegedly misbehaving with a woman, hurling abuses, and dropping her on a deserted road late in the evening. The incident occurred after the woman requested the driver to lower loud music, leading to an aggressive confrontation and her feeling unsafe.

title: After cutting Amazon stake: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions in 2025; 186 groups benefit
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: Delhi air pollution crisis: AQI remains very poor; 4 areas slip into ‚Äòsevere‚Äô zone
content: Delhi experienced hazy skies on Monday, with the overall air quality falling into the 'very poor' category. Four areas, including Narela and Bawana, recorded 'severe' AQI levels exceeding 400. This follows a similar trend from Sunday, when the city's AQI was also in the very poor range.

title: Elon Musk 'agrees' with Adam Kobeissi's warning to US govt on China
content: Elon Musk warns of a significant energy infrastructure crisis in the US, highlighting China's nearly three-fold lead in power generation capacity.  While China rapidly expands its grid with renewables and nuclear power, the US lags, threatening its competitiveness in AI and advanced manufacturing.

title: Gold price jumps record high to $4,383 ‚Äî What's driving the rally?
content: Gold prices reached a record high, driven by expectations of further US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts and a weaker dollar. The yellow metal's appeal as a safe haven has been bolstered by geopolitical tensions and central bank buying, with silver also experiencing significant gains.

title: French presidential palace robbery: Silverware worth thousands of euros stolen
content: Three men will face trial next year for allegedly stealing valuable silverware and tableware from the French President's residence. The items, including S√®vres porcelain and Baccarat glasses, are valued between ‚Ç¨15,000 and ‚Ç¨40,000. Investigations led to a palace steward, his partner, and a Louvre guard, with many items recovered. The trial is set for February 26.

title: 'India sees chaos': Hasina on 'reality of Yunus' Bangladesh'; blames interim govt
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina reacted to the death of student leader Sharif Usman Hadi, highlighting the deteriorating law and order in what she called the reality of Yunus‚Äôs Bangladesh. She accused the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government of failing to protect minorities and allowing violence to escalate across the country.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at ¬£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed ¬£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: 'Recovery isn‚Äôt optional': Why Chiefs Heiress Gracie hunt chose strength in 2025
content: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt reveals she gained 15 lbs during her 2025 fitness journey, explaining why strength, recovery, and long-term health mattered more than appearance. The Kansas City Chiefs owner‚Äôs daughter shares how intentional training, muscle gain, and consistency helped her finish the year stronger than she started.

title: Brittany Mahomes silent as Randi shares hope amid Patrick Mahomes recovery
content: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô season-ending knee injury has left the Chiefs in unfamiliar territory. While Brittany Mahomes has remained silent, his mother Randi publicly thanked fans for their prayers and support. As Mahomes begins a lengthy rehabilitation, the Chiefs face a rare playoff miss but remain optimistic about his full recovery and return in 2026.

title: Aditya rejected Tamannaah Bhatia for 'Dhurandhar' song 'Shararat'
content: Dhurandhar is a box office sensation, nearing Rs 550 crore. The film's music is a hit, especially the song Shararat. Choreographer Vijay Ganguly revealed Tamannaah Bhatia was initially considered for the song. Director Aditya Dhar wanted to avoid an item song that would distract from the story. The spy thriller continues its impressive run, outperforming major Hollywood releases.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 26,100; BSE Sensex up over 450 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 26,100, BSE Sensex surged over 450 points.

title: CBSE releases important notice on Hub & Spoke School Model; announces orientation programme
content: CBSE has announced an orientation programme for schools under its Hub and Spoke School Model to strengthen collaboration, resource sharing and student well-being. Scheduled for December 26, 2025, in Jaipur, the programme will bring together school leaders and counsellors to improve implementation, coordination and counselling practices. Registration is free, with limited seats.

title: 'Studied India's success': How can Pakistan's cricket be fixed? Selector reveals blueprint
content: Pakistan's chief selector Aaqib Javed revealed he's studied India's white-ball success to improve Pakistan's cricket structure. He stressed that quality talent, fostered by robust infrastructure and competition, is key to sustained success, not just individual brilliance. Javed expressed optimism about Pakistan's current team, especially with the upcoming T20 World Cup in familiar conditions.

title: Indonesia bus crash: Driver loses control, hits barrier; 15 killed
content: At least 15 people died when an inter-province passenger bus veered off a toll road on Java, Indonesia, early Monday. The bus, en route from Jakarta to Yogyakarta with 34 passengers, struck a barrier and overturned. The cause of the crash and the condition of the injured are still being investigated.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified Astra Microwave Products and Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals as top stock picks for the week of December 22, 2025. Astra Microwave is poised for growth in defense electronics, while Crompton aims to expand its market share in consumer electricals, particularly with its acquisition of Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 17: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 550cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has achieved a remarkable Rs 550 crore milestone, dominating its third weekend with record-breaking collections. The film outshone Hollywood's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' and is on track to become the highest third-week earner, potentially surpassing 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and 'Chhaava's' domestic hauls.

title: Maha local body poll results: Mahayuti sweeps 207 posts; MVA restricted to 44
content: The BJP-led Mahayuti coalition has secured a decisive victory in Maharashtra's civic elections, winning nearly 207 out of 288 council and nagar panchayat president posts. This performance mirrors their assembly election success, with the BJP emerging as the biggest gainer. The results consolidate Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's position and are seen as a significant win for the ruling alliance.

title: Elephant toll in Assam rises to 8; Jharkhand cancels 8 trains
content: Elephant deaths in Assam tragically rose to eight after a Rajdhani Express collision, prompting a speed restriction for trains. Meanwhile, Jharkhand's railway division cancelled eight trains due to heightened wild elephant movement near tracks, marking the third consecutive cancellation to prioritize animal safety.

title: 'Dhoka nahi deta': Mohsin Naqvi asked to appoint ex-Pak skipper as T20 WC mentor - Watch
content: Pakistan's U19 team triumphed over India in the Asia Cup final by a commanding 191 runs. Mentor Sarfaraz Ahmed's presence resonated with fans, leading to an emotional plea for his appointment as T20 World Cup mentor. This victory marks Pakistan's first U19 Asia Cup title in 13 years, with Sameer Minhas starring with 172 runs.

title: Building Mars colonies with ice: How scientists plan to make it possible
content: Mars' abundant ice offers a revolutionary solution for future human settlements. Scientists propose using this frozen water as a primary building material, providing crucial insulation against extreme temperatures and harmful radiation. This sustainable approach significantly reduces reliance on Earth-based supplies, making Mars colonization more practical and cost-effective, paving the way for a new era of space exploration.

title: Poll bonds scrapped by SC, trusts now swell BJP coffers
content: Scrapping electoral bonds has surprisingly boosted BJP's donations, with electoral trusts disbursing over Rs 3,577 crore in 2024-25.  This marks a significant increase, with the party securing 83.6% of all trust contributions.  While corporate donors sought anonymity, the BJP remains the primary beneficiary of this funding route.

title: 17-year-old gang-raped in fields; accused threatens to circulate video on social media
content: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped by three men from her village who lured her into fields. The accused, who had previously threatened to release compromising videos, coerced her into meeting them. The girl reported the incident the next morning after being held overnight.

title: Record! Mandhana becomes first Indian woman to achieve this rare feat
content: Smriti Mandhana made history in the first Women‚Äôs T20I against Sri Lanka by becoming the first Indian to score 4,000 T20I runs. She is only the second woman globally after Suzie Bates to achieve this feat and did it faster than anyone. India‚Äôs bowlers then restricted Sri Lanka to 121 runs.

title: Sarod player forced to flee Bangladesh hiding Indian identity
content: Renowned sarod player Shiraz Ali Khan fled Bangladesh to Kolkata after his concert venue was vandalized.  Hours before his performance, the cultural hub was attacked amid unrest. Khan, whose family has roots in Bangladesh, concealed his Indian identity to safely depart, while his tabla player remains stranded. He vows not to return until artists and cultural spaces are protected.

title: Patriots QB Drake Maye addresses rumors about wife Ann Michael ahead of SNF
content: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is leading his team with impressive poise, but off the field, his fianc√©e Ann Michael is capturing hearts. Her viral TikTok baking series, "Bakemas," has charmed fans with its warmth and authenticity, mirroring Maye's own steady presence. This blend of on-field success and genuine off-field connection is resonating deeply with New England supporters.

title: India shuts Chittagong visa operations as tensions rise
content: India suspended visa operations in Chittagong following protests sparked by the lynching of a Hindu man for alleged blasphemy. New Delhi slammed attempts to equate protests targeting its facilities with a demonstration outside the Bangladesh High Commission in Delhi, calling them misleading propaganda.

title: Aaron Rodgers‚Äô heartfelt praise for his wife deepens mystery
content: Aaron Rodgers has confirmed he is married but continues to keep his wife, Brittani, completely out of the public eye. His heartfelt comments describing her as ‚Äúincredible‚Äù have fueled curiosity, especially with no photos or appearances to confirm her identity. Rodgers‚Äô rare openness highlights a deeply private love story unfolding away from the spotlight.

title: Looking at RSS through BJP lens a big mistake: Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasized that viewing the Sangh through the BJP's lens is a "big mistake," clarifying the organization's goal is the "organization of Hindu society" without opposing others. He defined "Hindus" as those respecting their motherland, irrespective of language or rituals, and urged Muslims to recognize their shared national and cultural identity.

title: A first in 40 years: Kamptee president post goes to BJP
content: BJP secured the Kamptee municipal council president post for the first time in 40 years, with Ajay Agrawal winning by a narrow margin of 103 votes. The close contest saw allegations of malpractice from the runner-up, Congress' Shakur Nagani, who claimed a suspicious late shift in results.

title: Did Taylor Swift quietly acknowledge Blake Lively‚Äôs birthday message?
content: According to recent reports, Blake Lively quietly reached out to Swift on December 13, marking the singer‚Äôs 36th birthday. The message, sent privately, is being seen as a small but meaningful gesture that cuts through months of speculation.

title: 'Eggs in India safe for consumption': FSSAI rejects cancer risk claim; explains how
content: FSSAI has strongly refuted claims linking eggs to cancer, stating that eggs sold in India are safe. The authority clarified that the presence of nitrofuran metabolites below regulatory detection thresholds does not pose a health risk, as the use of these banned antibiotics is strictly prohibited in poultry production.

title: Who is Sidney Crosby‚Äôs girlfriend? Inside his life with Kathy Leutner
content: Sidney Crosby, the captain of the Pittsburgh Penguins, is one of the NHL's biggest stars, but he has kept his personal life private, as fans want to know more about his long-term relationship with Kathy Leutner, who has been there for him throughout his career, and their bond shows how Crosby's hockey success and Leutner's modeling success have come together. It gives us a look at their decade-long partnership behind the scenes.

title: North India shivers from intense cold, relief unlikely in 48 hours
content: North India is experiencing a severe cold wave with snowfall in higher reaches of Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, and Himachal Pradesh. Plains of Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan are facing dense fog and rain, pushing down temperatures. IMD forecasts continued wintry conditions for the next 24-48 hours.

title: Mid-air scare: Mumbai bound Air India flight returns to Delhi after one engine shutdown
content: VT-ALS returned safely to Delhi after one engine shutdown . the twin engine aircraft had taken off as AI 887 for Mumbai at 6.10 am and was back around 6.52 am, per flight tracing sites . passengers boarding commenced at 9.06 am and the alternate aircraft is expected to take off around 10 am .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Women's NCAA volleyball Way-Too-Early Top 10 for 2026
content: the transfer portal has yet to take hold in full . many rosters could get a shake up in the coming weeks . this top 10 is based on what we know now and is a little peek into how the run to next season's final four in San Antonio could shake out .

title: MLB offseason grades: Red Sox deal for Contreras, White Sox land Murakami
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 16: Broncos won't be the 1-seed? Macdonald is COY?
content: the pre-Sunday NFL Week 16 games were completely wild and massively consequential . the results feel weightier, mainly because there isn't much time left to fix problems that result from them . if the Buccaneers lose a playoff spot, they will meet again in week 18 .

title: Our reporters make sense of Week 16: Statement wins for Patriots, Jaguars, Panthers, Steelers, Bears
content: a game between the Rams and the Seahawks began with a Thursday night contest . the game was the first of the season, as the Bears beat the Packers . in the early window, the Panthers moved into first place in the NFC South .
